fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Culture, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Youth, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives: Policies and legislation with an impact at the regional level, more specifically in the fields of economy and regional development, cohesion policy, public health and social affairs, youth, culture, education, international cooperation, equal opportunities, institutional affairs.
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
subsection: Transnational associations and networks of public regional or other sub-national authorities
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: BERNTSSON#Magnus, COLLINS#Marykate, FREITAS#Vania, MAGRI#Luca, MORI#Matthieu, PACEVICIUS#Johanna
goals__remit:
The Assembly of European Regions (est.1985) is the largest independent network of regions in the wider Europe. Bringing together 150+ regions from 35 countries and 15 interregional organisations, AER's mission is to: 
- Promote the principle of subsidiarity and regional democracy  
- Increase the regions' political influence within the European institutions  
- Support the regions in the process of European enlargement and globalisation  
- Facilitate interregional cooperation across wider Europe and beyond
